p: Edema is a swelling due to excess accumulation of fluid in the intercellular tissue that results from an abnormal expansion in interstitial fluid volume [ 95]. Edematogenic causes edematous swellings and antiedematogenic inhibit the edematous swellings. An in vivo study stated that the aqueous extract of Leea giuneensis leaves showed antiedematogenic activity in carrageenan-induced rat paw edema model in mice [ 45].
